bibl.title: Visions of Gods: P. Vienna D 6633-6636, a Fragmentary Pantheon in a Demotic Dream Book.
bibl.note: The Vienna Fragments [P. Vindob. Dem. Inv. 6633-6636 (Fayum, ca. second century AD)]. - Gods in Other Ancient Egyptian Dream Books. - Visions of Gods: Dreams and Visitations. - The Epigones: Dreaming of Egyptian Gods out of Egypt and after the Demise of the Egyptian Religion.

bibl.title: A Good Scribe and an Exceedingly Wise Man. Studies in Honour of W.J. Tait

bibl.seg: Luigi Prada, Visions of Gods: P. Vienna D 6633-6636, a Fragmentary Pantheon in a Demotic Dream Book.

A.M. Dodson, J.J. Johnston & W. Monkhouse (edd.), Demotic Consultant C.J. Martin, A Good Scribe and an Exceedingly Wise Man. Studies in Honour of W.J. Tait = GHP Egyptology. 21 (London, 2014) pp. 251-270, 1 fig.

The Vienna Fragments [P. Vindob. Dem. Inv. 6633-6636 (Fayum, ca. second century AD)]. - Gods in Other Ancient Egyptian Dream Books. - Visions of Gods: Dreams and Visitations. - The Epigones: Dreaming of Egyptian Gods out of Egypt and after the Demise of the Egyptian Religion.
